text:
A Moment of Disgust

A young man walks through a shabby street.  
His thoughts spiral into a dark void.  
“I can’t believe this is my life.”  

---  

He mutters to himself, lost in despair.  
“Why do I even bother?”  
His ragged clothes weigh heavy on his heart.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The young man, despite his handsome appearance, is consumed by disgust and bitterness, reflecting on his dire circumstances and the rags he wears.
